components.description:
A wave of water, as breaks at the beach. Depicted as a blue wave with a foamy, white crest, curling to the right.

May be used to represent water in general, various bodies of water like oceans, and water activities, such as swimming, surfing, and sailing. May also be used to represent metaphorical waves.

Apple’s design resembles the iconic wave in Japanese artist Hokusai’s famous woodblock print, The Great Wave off Kanagawa (ca. 1830).
components.title: Water Wave

description:
A wave of water, as breaks at the beach. Depicted as a blue wave with a foamy, white crest, curling to the right.

May be used to represent water in general, various bodies of water like oceans, and water activities, such as swimming, surfing, and sailing. May also be used to represent metaphorical waves.

Apple’s design resembles the iconic wave in Japanese artist Hokusai’s famous woodblock print, The Great Wave off Kanagawa (ca. 1830).
title: Water Wave

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Weather, landscape, and sky symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A wave in the ocean or open sea. Could be used to surf on, or to jump waves at the beach. The Apple artwork for this emoji is based on the f http://emojipedia.org/water-wave/
emoji_net_data.name: water wave

bn:00113818a: Of an object: covered with or impregnated with liquid.
Covered or soaked with a liquid such as water
Of an object, etc, covered with or impregnated with liquid.
Drenched with water, or other liquid.
Covered with or impregnated with liquid.

bn:00094620v: To ride a wave, usually on a surfboard.
To use a surfboard; to surf.
Ride the waves of the sea with a surfboard

bn:00056171n: One of a series of ridges that moves across the surface of a liquid (especially across a large body of water)
Surface waves that occur on the free surface of water bodies
A moving ridge or swell of water occurring close to the surface of the sea, characterized by oscillating and rising and falling movements, often as a result of the frictional drag of the wind.
In fluid dynamics, wind waves, or wind-generated waves, are surface waves that occur on the free surface of oceans, seas, lakes, rivers, and canals or even on small puddles and ponds.
A moving disturbance in the level of a body of water; an undulation.

bn:00069946n: The sea, the world ocean, or simply the ocean, is the connected body of salty water that covers 70.8% of the Earth's surface.
A large body of salty water. (Major seas are known as oceans.)
A sea is a large body of saline water usually connected with an ocean.
A division of an ocean or a large body of salt water partially enclosed by land
The body of water covering most of Earth
A body of salt water that is smaller than an ocean and generally in proximity to a continent.

bn:00058574n: The oceans, seas, bays, estuaries, and other major water bodies, including coastal marine and nearshore zones.
The mass of water occupying all of the Earth's surface not occupied by land, but excluding all lakes and inland seas.
Oceans are major bodies of saline water, and the principal component of the hydrosphere.
A large body of water constituting a principal part of the hydrosphere
An ocean is a body of saline water that composes much of a planet's hydrosphere.

bn:00078509n: A very large and destructive wave, generally caused by a tremendous disturbance in the ocean, such as an undersea earthquake or volcanic eruption.
A cataclysm resulting from a destructive sea wave caused by an earthquake or volcanic eruption
A large seismically generated sea wave which is capable of considerable destruction in certain coastal areas, especially where submarine earthquakes occur.
Large, destructive wave generally caused by a tremendous disturbance in the ocean.
A tsunami Tsunami waves do not resemble normal sea waves, because their wavelength is far longer.
Series of water waves caused by the displacement of a large volume of a body of water

bn:00042379n: Chemical compound formed of molecules composed of two atoms of hydrogen and one of oxygen

Binary compound that occurs at room temperature as a clear colorless odorless tasteless liquid; freezes into ice below 0 degrees centigrade and boils above 100 degrees centigrade; widely used as a solvent
The liquid form of this chemical; liquid H?O.
Common liquid (H?O) which forms rain, rivers, the sea, etc., and which makes up a large part of the bodies of organisms.
Water is a common chemical substance, that is essential to all known forms of life.
Water is a transparent fluid which forms the world's streams, lakes, oceans and rain, and is the major constituent of the fluids of living things.

apple_vendor_description: The water wave emoji on Apple devices is a masterpiece of fluid design, featuring translucent blues and greens that capture the essence of ocean movement with Apple's signature realistic lighting. Its crest curls dynamically, showing off the smooth gradients and soft highlights that give it a tangible, refreshing quality. This emoji beautifully symbolizes nature, the sea, surfing, or a feeling of being overwhelmed, all presented with the polished elegance of Apple's emoji art.
